enWisdom: Through contemplation the darkness [and ambiguity] of matters get clarified
Correct opinion is [derived] through careful consideration

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالْفِكْرِ فَإِنَّهُ رُشْدٌ مِنَ الضَّلَالِ وَمُصْلِحُ الْأَعْمَالِ
enWisdom: You must reflect, as this is [means of] a guidance from error and a rectifier of deeds

Wisdom: فِكْرُ الْمَرْءِ مِرْآةٌ تُرِيهِ حُسْنَ عَمَلِهِ مِنْ قُبْحِهِ
enWisdom: A man’s thinking is a mirror that shows him his good actions from his bad ones
One who puts his mind to work arrives at the correct answer
One whose thinking is weak, his inattention [and gullibility] is strong

Wisdom: إِذَا أَمْضَيْتَ أَمْراً فَأَمْضِهِ بَعْدَ الرَّوِيَّةِ وَمُرَاجَعَةِ الْمَشُورَةِ وَلَا تُؤَخِّرْ عَمَلَ يَوْمٍ إِلَى غَدٍ وَامْضِ لِكُلِّ يَوْمٍ عَمَلَهُ
enWisdom: When you proceed with an affair then proceed after deliberation and seeking advice; do not delay your action of today to tomorrow, and perform each day’s action on that same day
